column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4606_bd0aa105198d3cc12751dc4645877af70cac6258/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
@theuni can you do a test run with this on MacOSX when you have some time?\n

~~Actually, looking through the code a bit more, I found the hack in at least one other piece of code. I'm going to fix it later today and will submit a revised pull request at that time. In the meantime, feel free to look at what I've already posted. I have no plans to revise it unless somebody makes a request.~~\n\nEDIT: After looking at the code more closely, the only other QTemporaryFile insta
Any reason for not using icon.pixmap().toMacCGImageRef() and cutting out the middle-man ?\n

~~Not really. I'm happy to give that a shot and revise the request.~~\n\nEDIT: Actually, I take that back. Looking at the documentation, it looks like that call was removed from Qt5. As I understand things from pull request #2721, Bitcoin-Qt is supposed to be compatible with Qt4 and Qt5. In fact, that's the pull request where this particular code was committed in the first place. I suppose I could

Okay. After doing some more digging, I think the patch should stay as is. The QPixmap::toMacCGImageRef() call was pulled from Qt5 and appears to have been reinstated in Qt5.2 as QtMac::toCGImageRef(). (See http://qt-project.org/doc/qt-5/qtmac.html for more info.) Writing a patch with three paths (Qt4, Qt5.0/5.1, and Qt5.2+) seems a bit silly when we already have a path that should work across Qt4
@droark Agreed. Instead of three #ifdef paths where this solution is used in a subset of qt versions, it's better to just use it for all so that it gets testing.\n

ACK. Works fine on 10.9.

We'll likely not be using QT < 5.2 for OSX at any point in the future, but there may be a few devs still building against it. At some point we can remove this and use the platform API if we stumble upon it again.
